relationships.description: Facility includes a waste management system.

Monitoring system monitors waste management system
Facility contains one water purification system
Facility contains one water storage system
Monitoring system tracks water purification status
Facility includes a water recycling subsystem.
Facility includes a water storage tank.

domain_model.plantuml:
@startuml

class Facility {
  -id: String
  -name: String
  -operationalStatus: Boolean
  +generateEnergyReport(): Report
  +testCriticalSystems(systemType: String): TestResult
}

class WaterSystem {
  -id: String
  -potableWaterLevel: Double
  -grayWaterLevel: Double
  -blackWaterLevel: Double
  -phLevel: Double
  -filterStatus: String
  +purifyWater(amount: Double): Boolean
  +monitorWaterQuality(): WaterQualityData
  +alertFilterMaintenance(): Alert
}

class WasteManagementSystem {
  -id: String
  -wasteCapacity: Double
  -currentWasteLevel: Double
  +processWaste(wasteType: String): Boolean
  +monitorWasteLevel(): Double
}

class StorageSystem {
  -id: String
  -storageType: String
  -capacity: Double
  -currentLevel: Double
  -temperature: Double
  +monitorConditions(): StorageConditionData
  +maintainTemperature(targetTemp: Double): Boolean
}

class HVACSystem {
  -id: String
  -currentTemperature: Double
  -targetTemperature: Double
  -status: String
  +adjustTemperature(targetTemp: Double): Boolean
  +monitorPerformance(): HVACPerformanceData
  +alertFailure(): Alert
}

class MonitoringSystem {
  -id: String
  -sensorNetwork: Map<String, Sensor>
  +monitorEquipment(equipmentId: String): EquipmentStatus
  +generateAlert(alertType: String, message: String): Alert
  +scheduleMaintenance(equipmentId: String, date: Date): MaintenanceSchedule
}

class CommunicationSystem {
  -id: String
  -downloadSpeed: Double
  -uploadSpeed: Double
  -encryptionStatus: Boolean
  +establishConnection(destination: String): Connection
  +transmitData(data: Data, destination: String): Boolean
  +monitorNetworkPerformance(): NetworkStats
}

class PowerSystem {
  -id: String
  -currentConsumption: Double
  -fuelLevel: Double
  -status: String
  +monitorConsumption(): PowerConsumptionData
  +generateReport(): Report
  +alertFailure(): Alert
}

class SafetySystem {
  -id: String
  -fireSuppressionStatus: String
  -medicalSuppliesStatus: String
  +monitorFireDetection(): FireDetectionStatus
  +monitorCODetection(): CODetectionStatus
  +checkMedicalSupplies(): SupplyStatus
}

class ControlSystem {
  -id: String
  -accessStatus: String
  -controlMode: String
  +authenticate(username: String, password: String): Boolean
  +performSystemUpdate(): UpdateStatus
  +switchControlMode(mode: String): Boolean
}

class LivingQuarters {
  -id: String
  -occupancy: Integer
  -maxCapacity: Integer
  -totalBeds: Integer
  +assignBed(personId: String, bedId: String): Boolean
  +monitorOccupancy(): OccupancyData
}

class SanitationFacilities {
  -id: String
  -showerCount: Integer
  -toiletCount: Integer
  -sinkCount: Integer
  -status: String
  +monitorUsage(): UsageData
  +scheduleCleaningMaintenance(): MaintenanceSchedule
}

class LaundrySystem {
  -id: String
  -washerCount: Integer
  -dryerCount: Integer
  -status: String
  +monitorUsage(): UsageData
  +scheduleMaintenance(): MaintenanceSchedule
}

class KitchenFacilities {
  -id: String
  -refrigerationUnits: Integer
  -freezerUnits: Integer
  -refrigerationSpace: Double
  -freezerSpace: Double
  -cookingEquipment: List<String>
  +monitorTemperature(): TemperatureData
  +trackFoodInventory(): InventoryStatus
}

class TransportSystem {
  -id: String
  -transportModes: List<String>
  -complianceStatus: String
  +verifyTransportability(transportMode: String): Boolean
  +prepareForTransport(transportMode: String): PrepStatus
}

class ResearchEquipment {
  -id: String
  -equipmentType: String
  -status: String
  -maintenanceSchedule: Date
  +monitorStatus(): EquipmentStatus
  +scheduleMaintenance(date: Date): MaintenanceSchedule
}

Facility *-- WaterSystem
Facility *-- WasteManagementSystem
Facility *-- "1..*" StorageSystem
Facility *-- HVACSystem
Facility *-- MonitoringSystem
Facility *-- CommunicationSystem
Facility *-- PowerSystem
Facility *-- SafetySystem
Facility *-- ControlSystem
Facility *-- LivingQuarters
Facility *-- SanitationFacilities
Facility *-- LaundrySystem
Facility *-- KitchenFacilities
Facility *-- TransportSystem
Facility *-- "1..*" ResearchEquipment

MonitoringSystem -- WaterSystem
MonitoringSystem -- HVACSystem
MonitoringSystem -- PowerSystem
MonitoringSystem -- WasteManagementSystem
MonitoringSystem -- "1..*" ResearchEquipment

ControlSystem -- HVACSystem
ControlSystem -- PowerSystem
ControlSystem -- WaterSystem

@enduml

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The water recycling subsystem shall filter water in accordance with safety water standards defined by regulatory bodies.

issues.description: The requirement does not specify which regulatory bodies or specific safety water standards should be followed.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify the exact regulatory bodies (e.g., EPA, WHO) and the specific water safety standards that must be met.

issues.description: The specific safety standards or regulatory criteria are not identified.
issues.suggested_fix: Reference the exact standards (e.g., EPA, WHO) and incorporate measurable criteria in the requirement.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The water recycling subsystem shall include a monitoring device that alerts the LSF when the filtering system requires change or maintenance, with data retrieved via a dedicated application.

issues.description: The term 'dedicated application' is ambiguous and not defined in the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify what the dedicated application is and how it interfaces with the monitoring system.

issues.description: It is unclear what the 'dedicated application' entails and how it integrates with the subsystem.
issues.suggested_fix: Provide details on the application’s interface, data exchange protocols, and integration with the monitoring device.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The water storage subsystem shall store potable, black, and gray water for occupants, meeting capacity requirements as defined in the Water Storage Tank SRS.

issues.description: References an external document (Water Storage Tank SRS) that is not provided, making capacity requirements undefined.
issues.suggested_fix: Include specific capacity requirements directly in this requirement or provide the referenced SRS document.

issues.description: The requirement is unclear about whether it refers to the WaterStorage class, the WaterStorageTank class, or both, and it relies on an external SRS for capacity details.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify which component is responsible for water storage and include explicit capacity metrics in the requirement.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Monitor the health of critical equipment via a network of wired or wireless sensors covering systems such as power generation, HVAC, water purification, waste management, and drilling.

issues.description: The requirement is not written in a shall statement format and lacks a clear subject.
issues.suggested_fix: Rewrite as 'The facility shall monitor the health of critical equipment via a network of wired or wireless sensors covering systems such as power generation, HVAC, water purification, waste management, and drilling.'

issues.description: The types of sensor data, performance metrics, and even the inclusion of 'drilling' (which is only partly represented via ResearchEquipment) are not clearly defined.
issues.suggested_fix: Detail the specific health parameters to be monitored and ensure that all listed systems, including drilling equipment, are adequately modeled.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Provide sufficient storage and maintenance space for expedition and drilling equipment, including heavy machinery, transport vehicles, and maintenance tools, with appropriate environmental controls.

issues.description: The term 'sufficient' is subjective and not quantified. Also, the requirement is not written in a shall statement format.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify exact storage space requirements and rewrite as 'The facility shall provide [X cubic feet] of storage and maintenance space for expedition and drilling equipment, including heavy machinery, transport vehicles, and maintenance tools, with appropriate environmental controls.'

issues.description: There is no explicit model element for maintenance space, and the domain model does not capture environmental control specifics for equipment storage.
issues.suggested_fix: Extend EquipmentStorage or introduce a new MaintenanceSpace class with relevant attributes and controls.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The LSF shall contain at least one radio for communication with McMurdo Station, which must operate on battery backup, feature a hand-crank function, and utilize solar power.

issues.description: The domain model has a 'radioAvailability' attribute in CommunicationSystem but doesn't include attributes for battery backup, hand-crank, or solar power capabilities.
issues.suggested_fix: Add attributes to the CommunicationSystem class to track these required radio features.

issues.description: The detailed features required for the radio (battery backup, hand-crank, solar power) are not represented in the CommunicationSystem model.
issues.suggested_fix: Add specific attributes or a dedicated Radio component with these features to the domain model.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall adhere to the 30-70-20 Pollution Prevention Policy.

issues.description: The '30-70-20 Pollution Prevention Policy' is not defined or explained in the requirement.
issues.suggested_fix: Include a brief description of what the 30-70-20 Pollution Prevention Policy entails or reference a specific document that defines it.

issues.description: There is no mechanism in the domain model to track compliance with specific environmental policies.
issues.suggested_fix: Enhance the ComplianceSystem or Facility model with attributes to capture policy adherence details.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall adhere to the 30-50-75 Environmental Effects Abroad of Major Agency Actions.

issues.description: The '30-50-75 Environmental Effects Abroad of Major Agency Actions' is not defined or explained in the requirement.
issues.suggested_fix: Include a brief description of what the 30-50-75 Environmental Effects policy entails or reference a specific document that defines it.

issues.description: Environmental policy adherence for this criterion is not captured in the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Extend the ComplianceSystem to include tracking for various environmental policies.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall employ built-in tests (BIT) on power, heating, water filtration, electrical, and fire/CO systems.

issues.description: The requirement doesn't specify what the built-in tests should check for or what constitutes a successful test.
issues.suggested_fix: Define the specific parameters that each built-in test should verify and the pass/fail criteria.

issues.description: While several systems incorporate BIT methods, the scope (especially for electrical systems) is not fully defined.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify and explicitly model BIT functionality for all listed systems, including adding any missing elements for electrical equipment.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall be designed using Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) technology wherever possible.

issues.description: The phrase 'wherever possible' is subjective and makes the requirement difficult to verify.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify criteria for when COTS technology should be used vs. when custom solutions are acceptable.

issues.description: There is no indication within the domain model that reflects a preference for COTS technology.
issues.suggested_fix: Annotate relevant components or add a note in the Facility model indicating the intended use of COTS technology.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Provide water for drinking and hygiene. The facility shall have a water purification system sufficient for both drinking and cooking, as well as for bathing, laundry, and restroom usage.

issues.description: The term 'sufficient' is not quantitatively defined with respect to the water purification system’s capacity and performance for drinking, cooking, bathing, laundry, and restroom usage.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify measurable parameters (such as flow rate, capacity, and water quality metrics) for each purpose.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The water storage subsystem shall include a monitoring device that communicates water quality and contamination levels to the LSF.

issues.description: It is not specified which storage component is to be monitored and what data will be communicated.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify whether the monitoring applies to the WaterStorage or WaterStorageTank component and define the communication protocol.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Process waste. The facility shall implement a disposal system for trash and waste that remains effective under extreme weather conditions.

issues.description: The types of waste and the precise performance criteria under extreme weather are not defined.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify waste categories and define measurable performance attributes (perhaps leveraging the weatherResistanceRating in WasteManagementSystem).

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Store non-perishable and perishable goods. Non-perishable items shall be stored in a clean, dry environment near the kitchen, while perishable goods require adequate refrigeration/freezing capacity for extended periods.

issues.description: The requirement specifies a location ('near the kitchen') which is not captured in the domain model, leading to a mismatch between physical placement and logical storage functions.
issues.suggested_fix: Either update the domain model to include spatial relationships (e.g., proximity to KitchenFacilities) or remove the location constraint from the requirement.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Provide reasonable temperature conditions. The HVAC system shall be capable of maintaining livable conditions in extreme Antarctic cold for all living and sleeping quarters.

issues.description: Terms like 'reasonable', 'livable conditions', and 'extreme Antarctic cold' are not quantified.
issues.suggested_fix: Define specific temperature ranges or thresholds for both the HVAC system and LivingQuarters.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Store ice cores. The facility shall be capable of simultaneously storing 20 ice cores at temperatures maintained between -40°F and 20°F.

issues.description: While the IceCoreStorage class exists, the requirement’s minimum capacity (20 cores) is not enforced by any constraint in the model.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a validation rule or constraint to the IceCoreStorage model to ensure the capacity is at least 20.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Provide reliable communication with external teams, including US research labs and McMurdo Station, supporting email, data exchange, telephone, and videoconferencing.

issues.description: The domain model’s CommunicationSystem does not explicitly address functionalities for email and telephone communication.
issues.suggested_fix: Either extend CommunicationSystem to include email and telephone support or adjust the requirement to match the modeled communication methods.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Support scientific data exchange with the US research lab through encrypted transmission.

issues.description: This requirement overlaps with other encryption requirements and may be redundant.
issues.suggested_fix: Consider consolidating encryption requirements to avoid duplication and ensure consistency across the model.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The LSF shall contain at least three computers to support data transmission, with data storage maintained on an encrypted server.

issues.description: While the CommunicationSystem lists a 'computerCount' attribute, there is no dedicated component representing an 'encrypted server' or detailing the computers’ role.
issues.suggested_fix: Either add a dedicated Server class or extend the CommunicationSystem and CloudStorage models to clearly represent these components.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The LSF shall be designed for transportability by LC-130 or C-130 Hercules aircraft to McMurdo Station.

issues.description: The domain model’s transport options list only includes LC130 (and other modes) but does not explicitly include C-130 Hercules.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the TransportSystem and relevant attributes (e.g., Facility.transportability) to include C-130 Hercules or clarify the intended aircraft type.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall be equipped with at least one first aid kit.

issues.description: There is no representation of a first aid kit or medical supplies inventory within the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Add an attribute to the SafetySystem or create a new MedicalSupplies component to capture first aid kit details.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall have at least one set of AED defibrillators compliant with 29 CFR 1915.87 (OSHA Maritime).

issues.description: No domain model element represents AED defibrillators or their compliance requirements.
issues.suggested_fix: Introduce a MedicalDevices or SafetyEquipment component within the SafetySystem that includes AED defibrillators.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall provide a minimum of 100 square feet of space for physical exercise.

issues.description: There is no model element representing a designated exercise area or recreational facility.
issues.suggested_fix: Add an ExerciseArea class or extend Facility with attributes that capture exercise/recreation space.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Provide food storage with at least three refrigeration/freezer units.

issues.description: The requirement calls for a specific number of refrigeration/freezer units, yet the FoodStorage model only defines capacities without unit counts.
issues.suggested_fix: Introduce attributes (e.g., unit count) in FoodStorage or KitchenFacilities to capture the number of refrigeration/freezer units.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The refrigeration system shall provide at least 48 cubic feet of refrigeration space.

issues.description: It is not clear whether the 'refrigeration system' refers to the KitchenFacilities, FoodStorage, or a separate subsystem.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify the component responsible for refrigeration and ensure that its capacity is explicitly modeled.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The freezer system shall provide at least 19.5 cubic feet of freezer space.

issues.description: Similar to REQ-034, it is unclear which subsystem is responsible for freezer storage.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify the responsible component and ensure consistent naming between the requirement and the domain model.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall include at least a two-burner table-top stove.

issues.description: The KitchenFacilities model only includes a 'stoveType' attribute without explicit details on the burner count or stove specifications.
issues.suggested_fix: Enhance KitchenFacilities with additional attributes such as stoveCount and burnerCount or specify the stove configuration more clearly.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall conserve energy by utilizing motion sensor switches and outlets.

issues.description: Although the EnergyManagementSystem includes a 'motionSensorActive' flag, it does not model smart switches or outlet control capabilities.
issues.suggested_fix: Extend the EnergyManagementSystem with components for smart motion sensor switches and controllable outlets.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall withstand wind speeds up to 250 mph.

issues.description: The domain model does not include any attributes or components representing structural resilience or wind load capacity.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a structural integrity or BuildingStructure component to Facility that captures wind resistance specifications.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall withstand ambient temperatures from -40°F to 80°F.

issues.description: Ambient temperature tolerance is not modeled in the Facility or related subsystems.
issues.suggested_fix: Introduce an environmental tolerance attribute in Facility or a dedicated EnvironmentalControl component.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility structure shall support a roof load of 60 lbs per square foot for ice/snow buildup.

issues.description: There is no representation of roof load or structural load-bearing capacity in the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Add an attribute to Facility or create a StructuralDesign class that specifies roof load capacity.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall store at least 150 lbs of food per week.

issues.description: Food storage in the model is based on refrigeration/freezer capacities and does not capture weight-based storage requirements.
issues.suggested_fix: Extend the FoodStorage component to include a metric for food weight or define conversion parameters between volume and weight.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility's database shall be capable of accessing and identifying all files within the storage system.

issues.description: No database or file management component is represented in the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Introduce a Database or FileManagementSystem class that interacts with the StorageSystem.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall be designed in accordance with the environmental protection protocol of the Antarctic Treaty.

issues.description: The domain model lacks any element that captures compliance with the Antarctic Treaty protocols.
issues.suggested_fix: Add relevant attributes to ComplianceSystem or Facility to represent adherence to international environmental agreements.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall comply with Title 21, Chapter I, Subchapters A, B, C, and D of the Federal Drug Administration.

issues.description: FDA regulatory compliance is not represented within the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Incorporate FDA compliance as part of the ComplianceSystem or add dedicated attributes for regulatory adherence.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall be designed and built in accordance with applicable OSHA regulations, including fall protection, hazard communication, respiratory protection, scaffolding, ladder safety, control of hazardous energy, eye and face protection, and machinery guarding.

issues.description: No components in the domain model capture OSHA compliance details or safety equipment beyond basic safety system attributes.
issues.suggested_fix: Enhance the SafetySystem or ComplianceSystem with subcomponents addressing OSHA requirements.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall be designed in accordance with the 2021 International Building Code.

issues.description: Building code compliance is not modeled anywhere in the domain.
issues.suggested_fix: Add attributes to Facility or ComplianceSystem to capture adherence to the 2021 International Building Code.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall be designed in accordance with the 2021 Fire Code.

issues.description: There is no explicit element for fire code compliance in the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Integrate fire code requirements into SafetySystem or ComplianceSystem.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall be designed in accordance with the Fuel Gas Code.

issues.description: The domain model does not capture compliance with the Fuel Gas Code.
issues.suggested_fix: Extend either FuelStorage or ComplianceSystem to incorporate Fuel Gas Code requirements.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility's communication protocols shall comply with US Federal Code of Regulations – Title 47.

issues.description: There is no explicit representation of FCC Title 47 compliance within the communication models.
issues.suggested_fix: Augment CommunicationSystem or NetworkSystem with attributes or methods that capture compliance with FCC regulations.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall generate potable water that meets EPA and WHO standards.

issues.description: The measurable water quality parameters required to meet EPA and WHO standards are not specified.
issues.suggested_fix: Include specific water quality metrics (e.g., pH range, contaminant limits) in the requirement and possibly within the WaterPurificationSystem model.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall meet MIL-STD-1366 Transportability Criteria.

issues.description: The MIL-STD-1366 criteria are not reflected in the current domain model’s transport or structural elements.
issues.suggested_fix: Incorporate transportability criteria into the TransportSystem or Facility attributes to ensure compliance with MIL-STD-1366.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall operate 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

issues.description: There is no explicit representation of operational availability or 24/7 operation in the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Add an operationalStatus attribute or a scheduling component to Facility indicating continuous operation.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall notify occupants of any heating equipment failures within 1 minute.

issues.description: No real‐time alert mechanism with a specified timing constraint is modeled for heating equipment failures.
issues.suggested_fix: Enhance HVACSystem, MonitoringSystem, or ControlSystem with a method that supports real-time notifications with defined response times.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall notify occupants of any climate control system failures within 1 minute.

issues.description: A mechanism to guarantee a 1‐minute notification for climate control failures is not modeled.
issues.suggested_fix: Integrate time-bound alert functionality into the relevant systems (HVACSystem, MonitoringSystem, or ControlSystem).

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall notify occupants of any water filtration equipment failures within 1 minute.

issues.description: There is no explicit model support for rapid notifications (within 1 minute) of water filtration failures.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a real-time alert method to WaterPurificationSystem or integrate such capability within MonitoringSystem.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall remind occupants to replace water and air filters as per the manufacturer's instructions.

issues.description: No reminder or scheduling system is modeled for filter replacement notifications.
issues.suggested_fix: Extend the MonitoringSystem or ControlSystem with maintenance scheduling and reminder capabilities.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall notify occupants of any fire or carbon monoxide equipment failures within 1 minute.

issues.description: The domain model does not implement a time-constrained alert mechanism for fire/CO detector failures.
issues.suggested_fix: Enhance the SafetySystem or MonitoringSystem with scheduled alert capabilities that meet the 1-minute notification requirement.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall test the power generation subsystem every 8 hours.

issues.description: There is no scheduled testing or BIT method specified in the PowerSystem to meet the 8-hour interval requirement.
issues.suggested_fix: Incorporate a scheduled BIT (built-in test) mechanism in the PowerSystem model.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall test the heating equipment every 8 hours.

issues.description: The HVACSystem does not include a scheduled BIT specifically for heating equipment.
issues.suggested_fix: Add or extend an existing method in HVACSystem to support BIT scheduling for heating components.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall test the water filtration equipment every 24 hours.

issues.description: No scheduled test functionality is defined for water filtration processes.
issues.suggested_fix: Enhance the WaterPurificationSystem with a BIT schedule mechanism for 24-hour testing intervals.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall test the electrical equipment every 8 hours.

issues.description: There is no explicit representation of electrical equipment or its BIT requirements in the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Introduce a model element for electrical distribution or extend the PowerSystem to include electrical equipment testing.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall test the fire detecting equipment every hour.

issues.description: The SafetySystem’s BIT for fire detection is not clearly defined with an hourly test schedule.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a scheduling attribute or dedicated BIT method in SafetySystem for hourly fire detector tests.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall test the carbon monoxide detecting equipment every hour.

issues.description: There is no explicit BIT scheduling for carbon monoxide detectors in the SafetySystem.
issues.suggested_fix: Incorporate hourly BIT functionality for CO detectors in SafetySystem.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Medical supplies shall be restocked weekly as needed.

issues.description: The domain model does not include an inventory or restocking process for medical supplies.
issues.suggested_fix: Extend SafetySystem with inventory management features to schedule or trigger weekly restocking.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Software and firmware updates shall not interrupt critical system functions.

issues.description: The mechanism that prevents interruptions during updates is not described in the model.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify an update strategy (e.g., hot-swapping or redundant systems) within the ControlSystem model.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Software and firmware updates shall be executed manually.

issues.description: The domain model does not differentiate between manual and automatic update processes.
issues.suggested_fix: Incorporate an attribute or flag in the ControlSystem to indicate the update mode as manual.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Control panels shall be accessible only from within the facility.

issues.description: The domain model does not enforce physical or logical access restrictions based on location.
issues.suggested_fix: Add constraints or attributes in the ControlSystem specifying that control panels are only accessible internally.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The facility shall notify occupants of routine maintenance for drilling or ice core analysis equipment via a monitoring device.

issues.description: There is no explicit mechanism in the model to notify occupants for scheduled maintenance of drilling or ice core equipment.
issues.suggested_fix: Extend MonitoringSystem or ResearchEquipment (and IceCoreStorage if applicable) to include maintenance reminder and notification capabilities.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The drilling equipment storage unit shall house replacement hardware.

issues.description: No dedicated component or attribute exists for a drilling equipment storage unit that manages replacement hardware.
issues.suggested_fix: Add or extend EquipmentStorage with details for drilling equipment and include attributes for replacement hardware inventory.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The crew shall monitor the control system using smart devices.

issues.description: The domain model does not include any representation of crew interactions or smart device interfaces for monitoring the control system.
issues.suggested_fix: Extend the ControlSystem with user interface components or add a separate UserInterface module that supports smart device monitoring.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The crew shall be able to control the facility via smart devices.

issues.description: There is no explicit support for remote control via smart devices in the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Enhance the ControlSystem to clearly support commands issued from smart devices, possibly by specifying additional access methods.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The monitoring system shall include a fire-suppression system.

issues.description: The requirement states that the monitoring system should include a fire-suppression system, but the domain model shows fire suppression as part of SafetySystem rather than MonitoringSystem.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify whether the fire suppression system is to be integrated with the MonitoringSystem or remain a part of the SafetySystem and update the model accordingly.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The potable water system shall feature a visible display of pH level.

issues.description: While the WaterPurificationSystem includes a displayPHLevel method, there is no representation of a visual display component accessible to occupants.
issues.suggested_fix: Extend the WaterPurificationSystem or WaterSystem with an interface or display attribute that explicitly models a visible pH level readout.

missing_requirements.description: No requirements for system availability or downtime limits
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The Facility shall maintain a minimum availability of 99.9% for all critical systems (power, HVAC, water, communications) with no single outage exceeding 4 hours under normal operating conditions.
missing_requirements.rationale: While REQ-060 states the facility shall operate 24/7, there are no specific availability requirements or maximum allowable downtime limits for critical systems, which is crucial for life support in the harsh Antarctic environment.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for emergency evacuation procedures
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The Facility shall provide documented emergency evacuation procedures and equipment (including emergency supplies, communication devices, and survival gear) sufficient to sustain all occupants for at least 72 hours in case evacuation is required.
missing_requirements.rationale: Despite the remote and hazardous location, there are no requirements addressing emergency evacuation procedures, equipment, or survival gear, which is essential for ensuring occupant safety in extreme conditions.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for handling system failures and degraded modes
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The Facility shall implement graceful degradation modes for all critical systems, maintaining essential life support functions for at least 72 hours in case of component failures, with prioritized resource allocation based on life safety requirements.
missing_requirements.rationale: There are no requirements addressing how the facility should operate in degraded modes when components fail, which is crucial for ensuring continued life support in this remote location where immediate repairs or evacuation may not be possible.

missing_requirements.description: There is no requirement specifying real‐time monitoring and reporting of the facility’s structural integrity status.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The facility shall continuously monitor its structural integrity using embedded sensors and report real‐time status via the centralized dashboard, automatically triggering alerts if any integrity issues are detected.
missing_requirements.rationale: Given the extreme environmental conditions anticipated, continuous monitoring of structural integrity is critical to ensure safety and allow for immediate remedial action before any catastrophic failure occurs.

missing_requirements.description: The ice core storage system currently lacks a real-time temperature alerting mechanism.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The ice core storage system shall continuously monitor its temperature and automatically trigger an alert if the temperature deviates from the specified range of -40°F to 20°F.
missing_requirements.rationale: Maintaining the correct temperature is essential to preserve the integrity of ice core samples, which are crucial for scientific research.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for power generation capacity
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The PowerSystem shall generate sufficient electricity to support all facility operations with a minimum capacity of [X] kW and include backup generation capabilities.
missing_requirements.rationale: While REQ-068 mentions testing the power generation subsystem, there are no requirements specifying the power generation capacity, sources (e.g., fossil fuel, solar, wind), or backup capabilities needed to sustain facility operations in Antarctic conditions.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for data backup and recovery
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The CommunicationSystem shall implement automated data backup procedures with a recovery point objective of no more than 24 hours and shall support full system recovery in case of data loss.
missing_requirements.rationale: While REQ-016 mentions encrypted data storage and REQ-017 references cloud-based storage, there are no requirements addressing backup frequency, retention policies, or recovery procedures for critical scientific and operational data, which is essential for research continuity in this remote location.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for monitoring system alerting thresholds
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The MonitoringSystem shall define specific threshold values for all monitored parameters (including temperature, water quality, power consumption, and waste levels) that trigger alerts, with configurable warning and critical levels.
missing_requirements.rationale: While REQ-009 mentions monitoring critical equipment and various requirements mention notifications for failures, there are no requirements defining the specific thresholds or conditions that constitute a failure or warning state.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for system initialization and shutdown procedures
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The Facility shall support controlled initialization and shutdown procedures for all subsystems, with defined sequences that prevent damage to equipment and ensure safety of occupants.
missing_requirements.rationale: There are no requirements specifying the procedures for safely starting up or shutting down the facility, which is important for deployment, relocation, and emergency scenarios.

missing_requirements.description: No requirements for structural integrity monitoring
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The Facility shall include sensors to continuously monitor structural integrity under extreme weather conditions, with alerts for any compromised structural elements.
missing_requirements.rationale: While REQ-041 through REQ-043 specify structural requirements for withstanding extreme conditions, there are no requirements for actively monitoring structural integrity or detecting potential failures before they become critical.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for user access control and authentication
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The ControlSystem shall implement role-based access control with at least three privilege levels (administrator, operator, guest), requiring unique authentication credentials for each user with automatic logging of all access attempts and system changes.
missing_requirements.rationale: While REQ-077 mentions password protection for the control system, there are no detailed requirements for user management, role-based access, or audit logging of system access and changes.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for maintenance schedules and procedures
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The Facility shall include a comprehensive maintenance management system with documented procedures, schedules, and resource requirements for all equipment, with maintenance intervals aligned with manufacturer recommendations or operational conditions.
missing_requirements.rationale: While some requirements mention maintenance alerts and testing, there are no comprehensive requirements for scheduled maintenance procedures, documentation, or resource planning across all facility systems.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for environmental impact monitoring and reporting
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The Facility shall monitor and report its environmental impact metrics (energy consumption, waste production, emissions) in compliance with the Antarctic Treaty environmental protocols, with monthly reports generated automatically.
missing_requirements.rationale: While REQ-049 through REQ-051 mention adherence to environmental policies, there are no specific requirements for monitoring, measuring, or reporting environmental impact metrics as required by the Antarctic Treaty and environmental regulations.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for monitoring and reporting on the structural integrity of the facility.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The facility shall continuously monitor and report on its structural integrity, including any signs of compromise due to extreme weather conditions.
missing_requirements.rationale: Given the extreme weather conditions in Antarctica, continuous monitoring of structural integrity is critical to ensure the safety of occupants and the facility's operational status.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for handling medical emergencies, including the availability and use of medical supplies.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The facility shall have a documented procedure for handling medical emergencies, including the use of medical supplies and AED defibrillators, and shall ensure all occupants are trained on these procedures.
missing_requirements.rationale: With at least one occupant having medical training, it is essential to have clear procedures for medical emergencies to ensure quick and effective response.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for the handling and disposal of hazardous waste.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The facility shall have a procedure for the safe handling and disposal of hazardous waste, in compliance with EPA and OSHA regulations.
missing_requirements.rationale: Proper handling and disposal of hazardous waste are critical to comply with environmental and safety regulations.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for the security of the CommunicationSystem, including protection against unauthorized access.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The CommunicationSystem shall implement measures to protect against unauthorized access, including encryption and authentication protocols.
missing_requirements.rationale: Secure communication is essential to prevent unauthorized access and ensure the integrity and confidentiality of data.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for the periodic testing of the SafetySystem, including fire suppression and CO detection.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The SafetySystem shall undergo periodic testing of all its components, including fire suppression and CO detection systems, to ensure they are operational.
missing_requirements.rationale: Regular testing of safety systems is essential to ensure they function correctly in emergencies.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for the redundancy of critical systems to ensure continuous operation.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: Critical systems such as PowerSystem, WaterSystem, and CommunicationSystem shall have redundant components to ensure continuous operation in case of failure.
missing_requirements.rationale: Redundancy is essential to ensure the facility can continue to operate even if a critical component fails.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for the handling and storage of ice cores to prevent contamination.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The facility shall have procedures for the handling and storage of ice cores to prevent contamination, including the use of sterile tools and containers.
missing_requirements.rationale: Preventing contamination of ice cores is critical to ensure the integrity of research data.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for the security of the CloudStorage system, including access controls and data encryption.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The CloudStorage system shall implement strong access controls and data encryption to protect sensitive research data from unauthorized access.
missing_requirements.rationale: Secure cloud storage is essential to protect sensitive research data and comply with data protection regulations.

missing_requirements.description: No explicit requirement exists for initiating facility startup and shutdown procedures and providing comprehensive real-time operational status reporting.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The facility shall provide a centralized control interface that enables authorized personnel to initiate startup and shutdown procedures, and retrieve real-time status reports of all critical subsystems and overall operational health.
missing_requirements.rationale: A robust operations management process is essential to ensure continuous 24/7 operation and rapid troubleshooting during expeditions in remote, harsh environments.

missing_requirements.description: There is no requirement for automated monitoring and scheduling of maintenance for research and drilling equipment.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The facility shall automatically monitor the operational status of research and drilling equipment and schedule routine maintenance based on usage data and manufacturer recommendations, with alerts sent to the maintenance team for any upcoming service needs.
missing_requirements.rationale: Proactive maintenance scheduling minimizes the risk of equipment failure during critical research operations and ensures continuous operability.

missing_requirements.description: The compliance system functionality in the domain model is not reflected in any requirement for continuous regulatory adherence monitoring.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The facility shall include a compliance subsystem that continuously monitors adherence to all applicable regulatory and environmental standards, automatically updates its list of standards as regulations change, and generates scheduled compliance reports.
missing_requirements.rationale: Automated compliance monitoring is essential to ensure that the facility consistently meets all legal, safety, and environmental requirements, especially given the wide range of involved codes and regulations.

missing_requirements.description: There is no requirement defining the user interface for accessing control and monitoring functions.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The facility shall provide an intuitive, secure user interface that delivers real-time monitoring, control, and status reporting of all subsystems, accessible via dedicated control panels and smart devices.
missing_requirements.rationale: A user-friendly, centralized interface ensures that critical information is readily accessible to authorized personnel, thereby improving operational efficiency and safety.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for system performance under load
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: All facility systems shall maintain specified performance levels when operating at maximum capacity with 5 occupants plus 1 additional personnel.
missing_requirements.rationale: The requirements specify minimum capacities for various systems but do not address performance degradation under peak load conditions, which is important for ensuring the facility can support the full research team during periods of intensive activity.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for user training and documentation
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The Facility shall include comprehensive user documentation and training materials for all systems, including standard operating procedures, troubleshooting guides, and emergency protocols accessible both in physical and digital formats.
missing_requirements.rationale: There are no requirements addressing user documentation, training, or knowledge transfer, which is critical for ensuring the research team can effectively operate and maintain the complex facility systems in a remote location.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for system scalability or expansion
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The Facility shall be designed to accommodate a 20% increase in capacity requirements (power, water, storage, computing) without major architectural changes.
missing_requirements.rationale: There are no requirements addressing the potential need to scale or expand facility capabilities during the mission or for future missions, which is important for adapting to changing research needs or team size.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for system interoperability standards
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: All facility systems shall implement standard communication protocols and data formats to ensure interoperability between subsystems and with external systems at McMurdo Station and US research facilities.
missing_requirements.rationale: There are no requirements specifying the communication protocols or data formats to be used between subsystems or with external systems, which is important for ensuring seamless integration and data exchange.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for the maintenance and calibration of sensors in the MonitoringSystem.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The facility shall schedule regular maintenance and calibration of all sensors in the MonitoringSystem to ensure accurate readings and reliable operation.
missing_requirements.rationale: Sensors are critical for monitoring the health of various systems; regular maintenance ensures their accuracy and reliability.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for the training of occupants on the use of the ControlSystem and other critical systems.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: All occupants shall receive training on the use of the ControlSystem and other critical systems, including emergency procedures.
missing_requirements.rationale: Proper training ensures that occupants can operate critical systems effectively and respond to emergencies.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for the documentation and reporting of incidents and failures.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The facility shall maintain a log of all incidents and failures, including their resolution, and generate periodic reports for review.
missing_requirements.rationale: Documenting incidents and failures helps in identifying patterns and improving system reliability.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for the energy efficiency of the HVACSystem.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The HVACSystem shall operate in an energy-efficient manner, with settings optimized for minimal energy consumption while maintaining livable conditions.
missing_requirements.rationale: Energy efficiency is critical to reduce fuel consumption and comply with energy efficiency standards.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for the periodic inspection and maintenance of the TransportSystem.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The TransportSystem shall undergo periodic inspection and maintenance to ensure it remains compliant with transportability standards and is ready for use.
missing_requirements.rationale: Regular maintenance ensures the TransportSystem is always ready for use and complies with transportability standards.

missing_requirements.description: There is no requirement for dynamic monitoring of waste levels and alerting when the system nears capacity.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The waste management system shall continuously monitor its current waste levels and generate an alert when these levels exceed 80% of its maximum capacity.
missing_requirements.rationale: Real-time monitoring and early alerts can prevent waste system overload and ensure that timely maintenance or disposal actions are taken, which is vital under extreme weather conditions.

missing_requirements.description: The domain model’s capability for food inventory tracking in kitchen facilities is not covered by any requirement.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The kitchen facilities shall continuously track food inventory levels, including recording expiration dates, and automatically generate alerts when stock levels fall below predefined thresholds.
missing_requirements.rationale: Real-time food inventory tracking supports efficient resource management, minimizes food waste, and ensures that perishable items are used or replenished in a timely manner during extended expeditions.

missing_requirements.description: There is no specified requirement for real-time reporting of control system access status and interface integrity.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall provide real-time status reporting of all access interfaces, including current access status and any unauthorized access attempts, ensuring that only authorized personnel can interact with critical systems.
missing_requirements.rationale: Enhanced transparency into access control helps maintain system security and enables rapid response to any unauthorized access, thereby protecting critical facility operations.

missing_requirements.description: The transport system lacks a requirement that defines automated procedures for preparing the facility for transport.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The facility shall include a transport system that automatically verifies compliance with MIL-STD-1366 and prepares all subsystems for transport via the selected mode (LC-130, helicopter, truck, or sled), confirming successful preparation before departure.
missing_requirements.rationale: Automated transport preparation enhances safety and ensures that the facility is quickly and securely relocated without jeopardizing subsystem integrity.

missing_requirements.description: The domain model for cloud storage does not include any backup and recovery functionality.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The cloud storage system shall implement automated backup and recovery mechanisms, performing full backups at least daily to ensure data integrity and availability.
missing_requirements.rationale: Robust backup and recovery processes are critical for protecting sensitive data and ensuring uninterrupted access in the event of data corruption or system failure.

missing_requirements.description: The current control system authentication mechanism does not specify the use of multi-factor authentication.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall implement multi-factor authentication, requiring at least two distinct forms of verification before granting access to critical functionalities.
missing_requirements.rationale: Multi-factor authentication significantly enhances system security, reducing the risk of unauthorized access in a high-risk remote operating environment.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement exists for centralized logging of all alerts generated by various subsystems.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The facility shall maintain a centralized log that records all alerts and notifications generated by its subsystems, including timestamps, alert details, and resolution actions, with the logs retained for audit and diagnostic purposes.
missing_requirements.rationale: Centralized alert logging supports thorough diagnostics, facilitates performance analysis, and ensures accountability for all operational anomalies.

missing_requirements.description: The fuel storage system does not have a requirement for monitoring and alerting on low fuel levels in conjunction with verifying regulatory compliance.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The fuel storage system shall continuously monitor its fuel volume and automatically generate an alert when the volume falls below a predefined safe threshold, while also performing periodic checks to verify EPA SPCC compliance.
missing_requirements.rationale: Continuous monitoring of fuel levels is essential for uninterrupted power generation, especially in remote operations where refueling opportunities are limited, ensuring both operational readiness and regulatory compliance.

missing_requirements.description: The domain model supports built-in testing for critical systems, but there is no requirement defining an integrated built-in testing mechanism.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The facility shall provide an integrated built-in testing (BIT) function accessible via the control system, allowing for periodic and on-demand testing of all critical subsystems (including power, HVAC, water purification, electrical, and fire/CO systems) with the results automatically logged for diagnostics.
missing_requirements.rationale: An integrated BIT mechanism is vital for proactively detecting and addressing system failures, thus ensuring the reliability and safety of the facility during continuous operations.

missing_requirements.description: There is no requirement to archive historical energy consumption data and perform trend analysis.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The energy management system shall archive daily energy consumption reports and enable historical trend analysis and performance review over extended periods.
missing_requirements.rationale: Historical data trend analysis is important for optimizing energy usage over time and for diagnosing potential inefficiencies or system degradations.

missing_requirements.description: There is no requirement addressing standardized interfaces for subsystem replacement and maintenance.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: All subsystems shall be designed with standardized hardware and software interfaces to enable rapid replacement, maintenance, and upgrades without disrupting overall facility operations.
missing_requirements.rationale: Standardized interfaces improve maintainability and reduce system downtime by facilitating quicker repairs and easier component upgrades.

missing_requirements.description: There is no requirement for automated bed allocation and amenity management within the accommodation system.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The accommodation system shall provide an automated mechanism to allocate beds to occupants based on current occupancy levels and allow occupants to view available amenities, ensuring efficient utilization of living space.
missing_requirements.rationale: Efficient bed allocation and amenity management improve operational efficiency and occupant satisfaction in the constrained environment of a remote life support facility.

missing_requirements.description: The eating area functionality in the domain model regarding capacity verification and dynamic seating arrangement is not addressed in the requirements.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The eating area shall continuously verify that its seating and table configurations meet the required capacity specifications, and automatically adjust its seating arrangement to accommodate varying occupancy levels.
missing_requirements.rationale: Dynamic management of seating arrangements is important to ensure that the eating area remains functional and compliant with space requirements as the number of occupants changes.

domain_model_issues.description: The Facility class has both 'transportability' and 'supportedTransportModes' attributes that seem to capture similar information.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Consolidate these attributes into a single attribute that clearly represents the facility's transport capabilities.

domain_model_issues.description: The HVACSystem class has both 'adjustTemperature' and 'regulateTemperature' methods that seem to perform similar functions but with different parameter types.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Consolidate these methods into a single method with consistent parameter types.

domain_model_issues.description: The MonitoringSystem class has both 'generateAlert' and 'sendAlert' methods with overlapping functionality.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Consolidate these methods into a single method that handles all alert generation and notification.

domain_model_issues.description: The CommunicationSystem class has both 'encryptionStatus' and 'encryptionEnabled' attributes that represent the same concept.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Remove one of these attributes and use a single attribute to represent encryption status.

domain_model_issues.description: The ControlSystem class has both 'authenticate' and 'authenticateUser' methods with similar functionality.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Consolidate these methods into a single authentication method with consistent parameters.

domain_model_issues.description: The domain model has multiple water-related classes (WaterSystem, WaterPurificationSystem, WaterStorage, WaterRecyclingSubsystem, WaterStorageTank) with unclear relationships and potentially overlapping functionality.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Clarify the hierarchy and relationships between these classes. Consider making WaterSystem the parent class with the others as specialized components.

domain_model_issues.description: The LivingQuarters class doesn't fully capture the requirements for accommodation described in REQ-021 through REQ-027.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Consolidate LivingQuarters, SanitationFacilities, and LaundrySystem into a more comprehensive Accommodation class as defined in the model, or clarify the relationships between these classes.

domain_model_issues.description: The SafetySystem class doesn't include attributes or methods for the AED defibrillators required in REQ-029.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add attributes to track the presence and compliance status of AED defibrillators.

domain_model_issues.description: The model has both a TransportSystem class and a TransportationDesign class with overlapping concerns regarding facility transportability.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Consolidate these classes or clarify their distinct responsibilities and relationship.

domain_model_issues.description: The MonitoringSystem class doesn't have methods to specifically handle the built-in tests (BIT) required in REQ-067 through REQ-073.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add methods to the MonitoringSystem class that specifically address the required periodic testing of different subsystems.

domain_model_issues.description: HVACSystem defines both adjustTemperature (with a Double parameter returning Boolean) and regulateTemperature (with a float parameter returning void), causing redundancy and inconsistencies.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Consolidate these methods into a single well‐defined temperature control method with consistent parameter types and return values.

domain_model_issues.description: The CommunicationSystem includes both 'encryptionStatus' and 'encryptionEnabled' attributes that appear to serve the same purpose.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Remove or clarify one of these attributes to avoid redundancy.

domain_model_issues.description: Two separate classes, WaterStorage and WaterStorageTank, exist with overlapping responsibilities regarding water storage, creating ambiguity.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Clearly define the roles of each class or merge them into a single component if appropriate.

domain_model_issues.description: FoodStorage is modeled as a specialized StorageSystem, yet its relationship to KitchenFacilities (which also stores food) is unclear.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Clarify the boundaries and interactions between FoodStorage and KitchenFacilities or refine the inheritance hierarchy to resolve the overlap.

domain_model_issues.description: The sensorNetwork attribute is defined as a Map<String, Sensor> but the Sensor type is not defined in the domain model.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add a Sensor class with appropriate attributes to complete the sensor network model.

domain_model_issues.description: The method suggests interfacing with a dedicated Windows PC, but no such PC component is represented in the model.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Either add a WindowsPC class or revise the method description to align with existing components.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Provide water for drinking and hygiene. The facility shall have a water purification system sufficient for both drinking and cooking, as well as for bathing, laundry, and restroom usage.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: Provide water for drinking and hygiene. The facility shall have a water purification system with a capacity of at least X liters per day, sufficient for both drinking and cooking, as well as for bathing, laundry, and restroom usage, with water quality meeting EPA and WHO standards.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks specific performance criteria such as capacity (liters per day) and quality standards. Without these metrics, it's difficult to verify if the implementation meets the requirement.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The water recycling subsystem shall filter water in accordance with safety water standards defined by regulatory bodies.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The water recycling subsystem shall filter water in accordance with safety water standards defined by EPA and WHO, with regular testing to verify compliance with these standards.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement doesn't specify which regulatory bodies' standards must be followed, making verification difficult. It also lacks information on how compliance will be verified through testing.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The water recycling subsystem shall include a monitoring device that alerts the LSF when the filtering system requires change or maintenance, with data retrieved via a dedicated application.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The water recycling subsystem shall include a monitoring device that alerts the LSF within 5 minutes when the filtering system requires change or maintenance based on manufacturer-specified thresholds, with data retrieved via a dedicated application on facility control devices.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement doesn't specify the criteria for triggering alerts or the expected response time. It also doesn't clearly state where the dedicated application will run.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The water storage subsystem shall store potable, black, and gray water for occupants, meeting capacity requirements as defined in the Water Storage Tank SRS.
missing_elements: Explicit capacity values within this document
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The water storage subsystem shall store potable, black, and gray water for occupants, with minimum capacities of X liters for potable water, Y liters for gray water, and Z liters for black water, as defined in the Water Storage Tank SRS document [document number/version].
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement refers to an external document without providing specific details or document reference. The actual capacity values should be included directly in the requirement for clarity.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The water storage subsystem shall include a monitoring device that communicates water quality and contamination levels to the LSF.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The water storage subsystem shall include a monitoring device that communicates water quality parameters (pH, bacteria levels, chemical contaminants) and contamination levels to the LSF control system every 6 hours, with immediate alerts when values exceed EPA-defined safe thresholds.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement doesn't specify which quality parameters are monitored, how frequently monitoring occurs, or what thresholds trigger alerts. These details are necessary for implementation and verification.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Process waste. The facility shall implement a disposal system for trash and waste that remains effective under extreme weather conditions.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: Process waste. The facility shall implement a disposal system for organic, recyclable, and hazardous waste with a minimum capacity of X kg per week that remains effective (maintains full functionality without leakage or system failure) under extreme weather conditions including temperatures down to -40°F and wind speeds up to 250 mph.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks specifics about waste types, capacity needs, what constitutes 'extreme weather', and how effectiveness is measured. These details are necessary for proper implementation and verification.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Store non-perishable and perishable goods. Non-perishable items shall be stored in a clean, dry environment near the kitchen, while perishable goods require adequate refrigeration/freezing capacity for extended periods.
missing_elements: Capacity or duration metrics for perishable storage
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: Store non-perishable and perishable goods. Non-perishable items shall be stored in a clean (meeting FDA food storage standards), dry environment (humidity <60%) near the kitchen with a capacity of at least X cubic feet, while perishable goods require refrigeration (33-40°F) and freezing (0 to -10°F) capacity of at least Y cubic feet to preserve food for up to 60 days.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks specific capacity measurements, temperature ranges for refrigeration/freezing, definition of 'extended periods', and standards for cleanliness. These details are necessary for implementation and verification.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Provide reasonable temperature conditions. The HVAC system shall be capable of maintaining livable conditions in extreme Antarctic cold for all living and sleeping quarters.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: Provide reasonable temperature conditions. The HVAC system shall be capable of maintaining temperatures between 65-75°F in all living and sleeping quarters when external temperatures range from -40°F to 20°F, with humidity between 30-60%, and shall restore temperatures to this range within 30 minutes after any disruption.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement uses vague terms like 'reasonable' and 'livable' without defining specific temperature and humidity ranges. It also doesn't specify the external temperature range it must handle or response time requirements.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Monitor the health of critical equipment via a network of wired or wireless sensors covering systems such as power generation, HVAC, water purification, waste management, and drilling.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: Monitor the health of critical equipment via a network of wired or wireless sensors (with 99.9% uptime) covering systems such as power generation, HVAC, water purification, waste management, and drilling. Sensors shall check equipment status every 5 minutes, with immediate alerts to the control system when parameters deviate by more than 10% from normal operating ranges.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement doesn't specify how frequently monitoring occurs, what conditions trigger alerts, whether there are redundancy requirements, or the performance specifications for the sensors themselves.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Provide sufficient storage and maintenance space for expedition and drilling equipment, including heavy machinery, transport vehicles, and maintenance tools, with appropriate environmental controls.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: Provide at least X cubic feet of storage and maintenance space for expedition and drilling equipment, including heavy machinery, transport vehicles, and maintenance tools. Storage areas shall maintain temperature between 40-70°F, humidity below 60%, and provide clear access paths of at least 4 feet width for moving equipment in and out.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement uses the vague term 'sufficient' without specifying actual capacity requirements. It also doesn't define what 'appropriate environmental controls' means in terms of temperature and humidity ranges, nor does it address accessibility needs.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Store ice cores. The facility shall be capable of simultaneously storing 20 ice cores at temperatures maintained between -40°F and 20°F.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: Store ice cores. The facility shall be capable of simultaneously storing 20 ice cores (each up to X inches in diameter and Y feet in length) at temperatures maintained between -40°F and 20°F, with temperature variation not exceeding ±2°F.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement is mostly complete but lacks information about the physical dimensions of the ice cores to be stored, which affects storage space design. It would also benefit from specifying the acceptable temperature variation.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Provide reliable communication with external teams, including US research labs and McMurdo Station, supporting email, data exchange, telephone, and videoconferencing.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: Provide reliable communication (minimum 99% uptime) with external teams, including US research labs and McMurdo Station, supporting email, data exchange (minimum 3 Mbps upload, 12 Mbps download), telephone, and videoconferencing. The system shall include a backup communication method that functions when primary systems are unavailable.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement uses the term 'reliable' without defining specific uptime metrics. It also doesn't specify bandwidth requirements for data exchange and videoconferencing, nor does it address backup communication systems for emergencies.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Support scientific data exchange with the US research lab through encrypted transmission.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: Support scientific data exchange with the US research lab through AES-256 encrypted transmission, capable of transferring up to X GB of data per day with verification of successful receipt.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement doesn't specify the encryption standard to be used, the expected volume of data to be transferred, or how frequently transfers will occur. It also lacks mention of verification mechanisms for successful data transmission.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The LSF shall contain at least one radio for communication with McMurdo Station, which must operate on battery backup, feature a hand-crank function, and utilize solar power.
missing_elements: Technical performance details such as frequency range or output power
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The LSF shall contain at least one radio for communication with McMurdo Station, operating on the frequency range X-Y MHz, with a battery backup providing at least 24 hours of operation, a hand-crank function capable of generating 30 minutes of use from 2 minutes of cranking, and solar power charging capability in low light conditions.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement doesn't specify the frequency range the radio should operate on, which is critical for compatibility with McMurdo Station. It also doesn't define the expected battery life or the performance specifications for the hand-crank and solar power features.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The LSF shall contain at least one camera for video conferencing.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The LSF shall contain at least one camera for video conferencing with minimum 1080p resolution, 30 fps frame rate, 90-degree field of view, USB or wireless connectivity, and compatibility with standard video conferencing software including [specific software names].
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks technical specifications for the camera, including resolution, frame rate, field of view, connectivity options, and compatibility with specific video conferencing software. These details are necessary for proper implementation.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The LSF shall contain at least three computers to support data transmission, with data storage maintained on an encrypted server.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The LSF shall contain at least three computers (minimum specifications: X processor, Y RAM, Z storage) to support data transmission, with data storage maintained on an AES-256 encrypted server with a minimum capacity of W TB and automated daily backups to a secondary storage device.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks specifications for the computers, the encryption standard for the server, the required storage capacity, and procedures for data backup. These details are necessary for proper implementation and data security.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The US-based Research Team shall establish cloud-based storage accessible by the facility via the World Wide Web.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The US-based Research Team shall establish cloud-based storage with a minimum capacity of X TB, accessible by the facility via the World Wide Web using multi-factor authentication, with AES-256 encryption for all stored data and 99.9% minimum uptime guarantee.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement doesn't specify the required storage capacity, security measures for access control, encryption standards for stored data, or availability requirements. These details are necessary for proper implementation and security.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The Research Team shall interface directly with a dedicated Windows PC and the radio system.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The Research Team shall interface directly with a dedicated Windows PC (minimum Windows 10, 16GB RAM, i7 processor) and the radio system using [specific protocols], with access controlled via unique credentials for each team member, to facilitate data exchange and emergency communications.
